summary: I am an analytical chemist with an extensive background in mass spectrometry, bioanalysis and forensic chemistry. My career so far has taken me to Germany, Brazil and the USA where I worked with a wide array of analytical instruments during the course of both fundamental and application driven research.

profile_positions.description:
FAPESP - Visiting Researcher / Pesquisador Visitante
In collaboration with prof. Graham Cooks (Purdue University, USA) and prof. Arian van Asten (Netherlands Forensic Institute, The Netherlands)

Project entitled: 
"Development and full validation of qualitative and quantitative ambient mass spectrometry based methods applied in forensic chemistry."

"Desenvolvimento e validação de métodos qualitativos e quantitativos em química forense usando espectrometria de massas ambiente."
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher

profile_positions.description: Visiting Research Scholar at Aston Labs, Purdue University. Working with illicit drug analysis in dried blood spots using miniaturized mass spectrometry. In collaboration with the Netherlands Forensic Institute.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Scholar

profile_positions.description:
- CAPES - Professor visitante
- Application of ambient mass spectrometry in forensic settings
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for quality control and assurance of analytical methods within the toxicology laboratory including ISO17025 certified methods.
- Method development and data processing of non-regular case work / research concerning the qualitative and quantitative analyses of prescribed and illicit drugs in various biological matrices.
- Data interpretation of toxicological screening in biological matrices using GC-MSn, LC-MSn, LC-UV.
- Study director of research projects involving the Dutch Road Traffic Act in collaboration with prof. R.G. (Graham) Cooks including a work visit to Purdue University.
profile_positions.title: Forensic Scientist Toxicology

company.name: Slotervaartziekenhuis, Netherlands Cancer Institute / Antoni van Leeuwenhoek Hospital

profile_positions.company: Slotervaartziekenhuis, Netherlands Cancer Institute / Antoni van Leeuwenhoek Hospital
profile_positions.description:
Development of qualitative and quantitative assays in biological matrices using HPLC-MSn. 
Identification of phase I and phase II metabolites in biological matrices.
Validation of assays according to GLP/FDA guidelines.
Studying the influence of ABC-transporters in biological systems.
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description:
Major internship master education
Supervisor: Prof. Dr. Dr. K-S Boos

• Development of an assay using on-line sample pretreatment of antimycotics in plasma using Restricted Access Material - SPE coupled to HPLC-UV. 
• Thesis: ‘Development and evaluation of a down-scaled SPE-LC system for direct injection and fully automated on-line UV analysis of antifungal drugs in human plasma‘.
